thread.title: Tunisia: Wage Negotiations in Public Service - Agreement Most Likely to Be Signed Early Next Week
thread.title_full: Tunisia: Wage Negotiations in Public Service - Agreement Most Likely to Be Signed Early Next Week

title: Tunisia: Wage Negotiations in Public Service - Agreement Most Likely to Be Signed Early Next Week
text:
Egypt: Who's Who in the New Cabinet? 
Tunis, — The agreement on wage increases in the civil service and public sector will be most likely signed early next week, informed sources told TAP. 
The Deputy Secretary-General of the Tunisian General Labour Union (UGTT) had told TAP the draft agreement provides for a 50- to 60-dinar wage increase for civil servants and public service employees from January 2016. 
It also provides for granting specific premiums (between 105 and 150 dinars) over three years: July 2016, April 2017 and April 2018. 
Regarding the public sector, which will benefit for the first time of specific premiums, the payment date is scheduled for January 2016, 2017 and 2018. Tunisia
